Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <D2D> Another question I have is, does it make a difference with the hack that happened with Agama if our wallet is encrypted or not?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <D2D> In Zelcore's wallet, encryption is by default, but in Agama it has to be done through the settings.

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Infinit0> I like how communicative the Verus community is. Very transparent. Unlike any other project I've looked at.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> In this case, I don't think it would have mattered if the wallet was encrypted, as I believe the exploit compromised code that would have had access to the encrypted data regardless. I should probably refrain from any more speculation until we hear more from Komodo. We should be patient until that time, but we are definitely learning everything we can from this.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> @D2D  There is no issue with creating test chains on test Agama. You don't have to wait. You do currently need to add public nodes to the definition, and you may have to add them to a conf file, but that should be simplified in the next update. You do not have to do anything in your Verus Agama. There was no issue, and unless you used the Komodo Agama on the same machine, your funds should be fine. You don't have to do anything.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> as long as you never loaded the new wallet on Komodo Agama, you should be OK, but to be sure, I think you would need to rename your wallet files between loading

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <D2D> But they can't hold ARRR, only Veruscoin and KMD

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <miketout> the right way to do it, and you may want to do it again to be sure would be:
1. Close Komodo Agama
2. Rename the wallet.dat in the ~/.komodo folder to wallet-old.dat and the wallet.dat in the ~/.komodo/VRSC and ~/.komodo/PIRATE folder  (or other komodo family chains) to wallet-old.dat
3. Load Verus Agama wallet. Make sure before you do that all folders of coins do not have a wallet.dat file in them.
4. Activate each coin and create the addresses to send to. Copy them to some editor, so you can send to them
5. Close Verus Agama
6. Rename all wallet.dat files in all directories to wallet-new.dat
7. Rename all wallet-old.dat files in all directories to wallet.dat
8. Load Verus Agama
9. Send all funds to the new addresses on each coin
10. Close Verus Agama
11. Rename all wallet-new.dat files to wallet.dat
12 Load Verus Agama

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> basically #1 is not necessary if you are sure that you never load it again. You can do all of the new things with Verus Agama only

Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> basically, each coin has a wallet.dat in a data folder, which has all of your keys and saves the transactions as well

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> you need new ones, which will be made automatically if the old one is not present or renamed

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> whichever one is named wallet.dat in the right directory when you load is the one that will be activated

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <D2D> How do I do these changes to ~/.komodo, through the terminal or just normal search in Finder

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> if you assume that the ones you ran Komodo Agama on may be compromised, these steps make new wallets for you and then you load the old ones, which you can do on Verus Agama to send the coins to the new ones, which aren't compromised

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> I don't really use Mac, but those folders are the locations on Linux. I need to check with someone on Mac. I think they are in a place called Application Support and then with similar directories. Let me check the source.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> It looks like ~/Library/Application Support/Komodo and then below

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <D2D> what if I move both Verus and ARRR out to Digital Price for example, delete the Veruscoin version of Agama, re-download it, then create two new wallets and send the coins back from Digital Price?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> you don't need to delete the app

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <D2D> OK

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> the only one you should delete is Komodo Agama

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> it is the wallet.dat files that are your actual wallet keys and transactions

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <D2D> OK. But is it enough to just send  the app from Applications to Trash, or are there more hidden files that need to be deleted?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> the app can stay where it is, and when you change the wallet.dat (only when the app is closed), it will be the different wallet

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <D2D> I mean to delete the old Agama app

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> you should not load the Komodo app again, but the wallet.dat can still be accessed by Verus Agama

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> ah, yes. it should be ok to just delete the app

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <D2D> OK thanks

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> but please make sure you locate your wallet.dat files

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> they hold all your funds, nothing else

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <D2D> But if I move them to a DigitalPrice wallet, then create a new wallet in Agama (Verus version) I'll be fine

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <D2D> And after send them back from Digital Price to the new wallet

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <D2D> As long as I delete the old version of Agama

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> Only if you create a new wallet.dat

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> otherwise, it will be the same wallet and the private keys to at least some of the addresses may be compromised

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> so, you would need to delete the old Agama and also the wallet.dat after you are sure DP has your funds

Author: Gateway#3763
